intro: Crotalaria fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it has a shallow root system that allows it to thrive in various soil types. Crotalaria fascicularis is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant in soil enrichment.
